thread.title: City to host memorial tribute to NBA Hall of Famer, city native Moses Malone
thread.title_full: City to host memorial tribute to NBA Hall of Famer, city native Moses Malone

author: Staff Reports
title: City to host memorial tribute to NBA Hall of Famer, city native Moses Malone
text: City to host memorial tribute to NBA Hall of Famer, city native Moses Malone The City of Petersburg and Petersburg City Public Schools will host a memorial tribute for Petersburg High School alumnus and NBA Hall of Famer Moses Malone. Comment Follow @ProgressIndex Posted Oct. 9, 2015 at 10:03 am Updated at 5:37 PM PETERSBURG â€” The City of Petersburg and Petersburg City Public Schools will host a memorial tribute for Petersburg High School alumnus and NBA Hall of Famer Moses Malone. The event is open to the public and will be on Saturday, Oct. 24 at 1 p.m. at Petersburg High School gymnasium at 3101 Johnson Road. Cavell Phillips will emcee the event. City leaders, former coaches and teammates will pay tribute to Malone. The Petersburg native and basketball legend passed away suddenly on Sept. 13 in Norfolk at age 60. A funeral service was held on Monday, September 19, 2015 in Houston, Texas. Moses Malone graduated Petersburg High School in 1974 as the first basketball player to play for a national basketball team right out of high school.
